Austria

September 2021

To promote self-regulation for the protection of minors, KommAustria adopted guidelines on September 15, 2021 which will serve as support in coping with the effort of self-regulation in relation to the classification of content that may impair the physical, mental or moral development of minors. https://www.rtr.at/medien/aktuelles/neuigkeiten/2021/News09172021selbskontrolle_schutzminderjaehriger.de.html

March 2021

KommAustria issued guidelines for the transparent expansion of accessibility in audiovisual media. In these guidelines, KommAustria specifies how planned measures are to be presented in a three-year action plan. https://www.rtr.at/medien/presse/pressemitigungen/presseinformationen_2021/PI03262021KOA_ Directive_Barrierefreiheit.de.html

Law entered into force on 1 January 2021.

The Federal law amending the Audiovisual Media Services Act, the KommAustria Act, the ORF Act and the Private Radio Act (federal law by which the Audiovisual Media Services Act, the KommAustria Act, the ORF Law and the private radio law are changed) of the National Council was published on 23 December 2021:

https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/Documents/BgblAuth/BGBLA_2020_I_150/BGBLA_2020_I_150.pdfsig

https://www.parlament.gv.at/PAKT/VHG/XXVII/I/I_00462/index.shtml#tab-ParlamentarischesProcedure

On September 15, 2020,

a draft federal law amending the Audiovisual Media Services Act, the KommAustria Act, the ORF Act and the Private Radio Act was published by the ministry.
